reason.tex: %text Function composition is the act of applying one function $f(x)$ on another function $g(x)$ to produce a third function $h(x)$. Mathematically, this is written as: % \begin{align} h(x) = f\left[ g(x) \right] = (f\circ g)(x) \end{align} \\ %text Note: $(f\circ g)(x) \neq (g\circ f)(x)$. A couple of examples should help clarify the concept % \begin{align} \begin{tabular}{NNNN} \hline f(x) & g(x) & (f\circ g)(x) & (g\circ f)(x) \\ \hline\hline x^2 & \sin x & f \left(\sin x \right) = \sin^2 x & g \left(x^2 \right) = \sin x^2 \\ \hline \tan x & \sqrt{x} & f \left(\sqrt{x} \right) = \tan\sqrt{x} & g \left(\tan x\right) = \sqrt{\tan x} \\ \hline \end{tabular} \end{align}
